comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: We're looking for your help! Please help us identify the unnamed in this photograph in the comments below.

comment.author: 65387364@N08
comment._content: CORRECIION: The man identified as Fred E. Robinson in the photo with The Table from Robinson Drug Store is not Fred Robinson, it is my grandfather who was know during the trial as 'the Hustling Druggist' and his name is Frank Earle (F. E.) Robinson not Fred. Fred Robinson was the owner of Robinson Manufacturing Company which is located in Dayton. Frank Earle Robinson, he went by F. E., owned Robinson Drug Store and was also the CHairman of the Rhea County School Board at the time of the trial. The table pictured here is the table at which the idea for the trial was originally born. Signed: Ann Gabbert Bates, granddaughter of F. E. Robinson.

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/65387364@N08] Thank you for your response! I will forward this information to our archivists and researchers and reply back soon with any updates. 

Best, 

Susannah 
Smithsonian Institution Archives
